entry.title: Armenian citizens required to declare incomes starting next year

media:group.media:title: Armenian citizens required to declare incomes starting next year
media:group.media:description:
üìçFrance‚Äôs Senate voted nearly unanimously to adopt a resolution calling on Paris to impose sanctions on Baku. üìçArmen Grigoryan, the head of Armenia‚Äôs Security Council, will travel to India for a working visit. üìçA new law requiring Armenian citizens to declare their incomes will come into force next year.

entry.title: Subsidizing salaries to attract highly qualified specialists to Armenia

media:group.media:title: Subsidizing salaries to attract highly qualified specialists to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Hovsep Patvakanyan, the head of the Investment Council of Armenia, sat down with CivilNet to discuss a new government program subsidizing salaries for highly qualified specialists up to 70%, meant to address Armenia‚Äôs shortage of highly-skilled labor. Patvakanyan also talked about a new investment package for the southern Vayots Dzor and Syunik regions, which are still reeling from Azerbaijan‚Äôs unprecedented September attack.

entry.title: In day-to-day life, Syunik‚Äôs border villagers face challenges created by Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: In day-to-day life, Syunik‚Äôs border villagers face challenges created by Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of #Frontlines, Karnig Kerkonian and Garo Ghazarian continue unpacking their fact-finding mission to Armenia‚Äôs southernmost Syunik region with Arman Tatoyan, the director of the Tatoyan Foundation. In this episode, residents of Syunik‚Äôs border villages explain how Azerbaijan‚Äôs actions have created humanitarian problems and disruptions to their daily lives.

entry.title: Armenia in favor of Russian peace proposals, Pashinyan tells Russian envoy

media:group.media:title: Armenia in favor of Russian peace proposals, Pashinyan tells Russian envoy
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken agreed in a phone call to continue steps to increase security and stability in the region.
üìçArmenia supports proposals presented by Russia in August to normalize relations with Azerbaijan, Pashinyan said.
üìçPashinyan accused Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev of inciting hatred and terrorizing the population of Armenia, after Aliyev said that southern Armenian cities are within Azerbaijan‚Äôs sight.

entry.title: Smoking bans, nutrition policies, diaspora professionals and Armenia‚Äôs health care system

media:group.media:title: Smoking bans, nutrition policies, diaspora professionals and Armenia‚Äôs health care system
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Kim Hekimian is an Assistant Professor at the Institute of Human Nutrition at Columbia University in New York and an advisor to the Armenian Health Ministry. Dr. Hekimian sat down with CivilNet to discuss the Armenian government‚Äôs new approaches to involve professionals from the diaspora in developing Armenia‚Äôs public health priorities. Dr. Hekimian also talked about Armenia‚Äôs nutrition policies and the work of organizations like the HENAR Foundation in modernizing Armenia‚Äôs health care system.

entry.title: ‚ÄúAn educated society is the future for Armenia‚Äù, Suren Aloyan

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúAn educated society is the future for Armenia‚Äù, Suren Aloyan
media:group.media:description:
Suren Aloyan, in conversation with Lara Tcholakian, shares his journey and goal to improve the education system and education technologies both in Armenia and abroad. He speaks about his experience in founding and leading educational technological organizations such as Dasaran and the PopUp School, as well as the implementation of the Koreez Educational Oscars to help discover talented students and honor teachers. He touches upon the dire need to strengthen and increase the role and reputation of teachers in Armenia. He also reflects on the perspectives required for a more viable nation.
About Suren Aloyan Suren Aloyan is a social entrepreneur, the Founding President of Dasaran Ed-Tech company, and the Co-Founder and CEO of PopUp School EdTech Inc. In 2016, Dasaran was recognized as one of the best 5 innovative enterprises in the world by the UNDP in its Accelerate 2030 initiative. Suren has served as Chief Expert in Armenia‚Äôs Ministry of Defense for 11 years and received the Admiral Isakov Medal of Honour in 2012. He has also received the Golden Commemorative Medal, the highest award of Armenia‚Äôs Ministry of Education and Science in 2016 and was honored with the High state award by the country‚Äôs president in 2017. In 2021, the World Economic Forum honored Suren Aloyan as the 2021 Young Global Leader, the first ever Armenian national to be honored this title.
Program overview In a new open setting, Lara deconstructs inherited cultural and historical narratives, memories, life lessons and experiences from change catalysts. Her guests reflect on the stories, people, events and mindsets that have shaped their professional and personal lives, enabling them to create a more mindful life.
